common_issues.title: Pieces OS Performance Issues and High CPU Usage
common_issues.description: Users report slow performance, lag, and high CPU usage with Pieces OS, particularly after enabling Long Term Memory. Issues are linked to specific versions, WebView applications, and hardware configurations. Solutions include updating Pieces OS and related components, applying hotfixes, and troubleshooting specific configurations. While resolved for some, the development team continues to investigate and address remaining cases.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: High CPU Usage with LTM-2

**Key Points Raised:**

* High CPU usage reported on Windows and Linux machines after enabling Long Term Memory (LTM) engine, especially with Microsoft Edge and other WebView applications.
* Lag and sluggishness experienced in Microsoft Edge.
* Issue persisted even after applying hotfixes and updates.

**Problems Identified:**

* Increased CPU utilization on various hardware configurations with LTM-2.
* WebView applications (like Edge) consuming high CPU resources.
* Performance drops after prolonged use, particularly with heavy workloads.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Multiple hotfixes and patches released.
* Further investigation of the issue and its underlying causes.
* Analyzing WebView and LTM-2 interaction.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* **Resolved for some users:** 
    * Issue resolved on certain configurations after updating Microsoft Edge and WebView2 Runtime to versions 134.0.3124.51.
    * Full resolution achieved with PiecesOS update v11.2.3 released on 2025-03-22.
* **Work in Progress:**
    * Investigation into remaining cases with persistent high CPU usage.
    * Potential future fix for affected installations.

**Additional Notes:**

* Temporary workaround suggested: Briefly disabling and re-enabling LTM-2 may improve performance temporarily.
* Moving com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd folders to a ReFS volume and creating symbolic links might improve performance on SSDs.

**Overall:** While the issue appears resolved for users who updated to specific versions and the latest PiecesOS update, the team continues to investigate remaining cases.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Conversation Summary for GitHub Issue: Copilot Lag

**Key Points:**

* Multiple users reported significant lag in Copilot response times after the release of Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* Users confirmed the issue was present even after performing hard resets.
* One user reported the application working fine after the updates.
* Subsequent updates to Pieces OS and Desktop versions caused the lag issue to reappear for some users.

**Problems Identified:**

* A bug in the hard reset functionality of Copilot caused the websocket not to re-initialize correctly.
* Performance regressions in later updates reintroduced lag issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix for the bug causing the lag was implemented and released in a patch.
* Subsequent updates aimed at improving performance and addressing regressions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The initial bug causing lag after hard resets was fixed.
* Some users continue to experience lag, indicating that performance issues may persist.
* Further investigation and troubleshooting are likely required to address remaining lag concerns.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of timely communication and updates from developers to address user issues.
* It also emphasizes the need for thorough testing and regression avoidance during software development.

related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Sean encountered a bug where the Pieces copilot wasn't properly responding to his questions after 11 requests and 11 responses.
* Sean was unable to reproduce the bug on Mark's end.
* Sean confirmed that the bug didn't occur when using the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark suggested Sean switch to the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The bug was likely fixed by using the Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
* The issue was closed with the suggestion of reopening if the bug persisted after the 11.2.3 update.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Users on M3 macs are experiencing issues with PiecesOS entering "basic mode" due to device constraints.
* The issue manifests as missing features, including the Workstream Activity view and LTM updates.
* The issue can be temporarily resolved by restarting PiecesOS.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS incorrectly identifies M3 macs as having limited resources and disables advanced features.
* Some UI elements are missing or hidden when the window is resized.
* Users are unable to access Workstream Activity and LTM updates.
* The reason behind the "Unknown Origin" application with version 1.0.10 is unclear.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A fix for the "basic mode" issue will be included in the next PiecesOS version.
* An enhancement to improve interface intuitiveness in small window sizes will be considered.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The fix for the "basic mode" issue is planned for the next PiecesOS update.
* The issue with missing UI elements in small windows may be addressed in a future update.
* Further investigation is needed to determine the cause of the "Unknown Origin" application and the LTM update issue.

**Additional notes:**

* The "Unknown Origin" application may be related to a previously installed version of PiecesOS.
* Users are encouraged to report any further issues they encounter.

Pieces OS unable to enable LTM

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## GitHub conversation summary: Permission issue with LTM activation in Pieces

**Key points:**

* User (@kwburgess) reported issues activating LTM in Pieces.
* Pieces support bot flagged the issue and provided relevant resources.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a permissioning problem on the user's machine.
* Required permissions related to screen & system recording and accessibility were highlighted.
* User confirmed the resolution and thanked the support team.

**Problems identified:**

* User was unable to activate LTM due to insufficient permissions.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* @mark-at-pieces identified the specific permissions needed and provided instructions/screenshots for enabling them.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user successfully activated LTM after enabling the required permissions. 
* The issue is resolved. 

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation demonstrates Pieces' efficient support system with automatic routing and helpful resources.
* The identified issue and solution might be relevant for other users facing similar problems.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation

**Key Points:**

* **Problem:** Pieces-OS installed as a snap lacks `curl`, preventing Ollama download and installation.
* **Solution:** Modify snap definition file to include `curl`.
* **Status:** Patch implemented but not yet released (as of March 19, 2025).

**Timeline:**

* **Dec 18, 2024:** User reports issue with Ollama installation.
* **Dec 19, 2024:** Problem identified as missing `curl`.
* **Dec 19, 2024:** Pieces confirms issue and promises patch.
* **Jan 23, 2025:** Patch still not released, user inquires about progress.
* **Jan 28, 2025:** Pieces acknowledges delay and resumes work on patch.
* **Feb 03, 2025:** Users express urgency to resolve the issue.
* **Mar 03, 2025:** Users inquire about update on the patch.
* **Mar 19, 2025:** Debug log confirms missing `curl`. Latest update available on the issue.

**Current Outcome:**

* Patch for including `curl` in the snap is implemented but not yet available for users.
* Users are unable to download and install Ollama.
* There is no estimated release date for the patch.

Unable to generate personal shareable links for 6+ months
### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension, VS Code, Sharing Web App

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.12

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I've been unable to generate shareable personal links and utilize the web sharing app since before June '24. I've created an issue about this twice before, and the last time was just completely disregarded and it was closed out.

Here is the screenshot from within my Pieces Desktop when trying to generate a personal link, as well as generate a GitHub Gist:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0966a1a9-3076-4d9b-9006-88a14673cc9f)
## GitHub Issue Summary: Shareable Links Not Working

**Key Points:**

* User `tombinga` reported issues with shareable links not working.
* The issue was caused by outdated infrastructure behind the feature.
* Shareable links stability should be improved after upgrading to Pieces OS v10.1.13.
* However, some users may still experience issues after the update.

**Problems Identified:**

* Shareable links not working as expected.
* Infrastructure powering shareable links was outdated.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces, a Pieces employee, offered to schedule time with users to diagnose their cloud issues and clean up their cloud.
* A fix was identified and included in Pieces OS v10.1.13, improving shareable link stability.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The original issue was resolved with the release of v10.1.13.
* Some users still reported issues with shareable links, including GitHub Gist generation, even after updating.
* Further investigation and a separate issue were opened to address the persisting problems.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces mentioned upcoming upgrades to Shareable links and cloud features in December 2024.
* As of March 23, 2025, some users are still experiencing issues with shareable links.

## Conversation Summary for GitHub Issue: Copilot Lag

**Key Points:**

* Multiple users reported significant lag in Copilot response times after the release of Pieces OS 10.0.2 & Pieces Desktop 3.0.2.
* Users confirmed the issue was present even after performing hard resets.
* One user reported the application working fine after the updates.
* Subsequent updates to Pieces OS and Desktop versions caused the lag issue to reappear for some users.

**Problems Identified:**

* A bug in the hard reset functionality of Copilot caused the websocket not to re-initialize correctly.
* Performance regressions in later updates reintroduced lag issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix for the bug causing the lag was implemented and released in a patch.
* Subsequent updates aimed at improving performance and addressing regressions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The initial bug causing lag after hard resets was fixed.
* Some users continue to experience lag, indicating that performance issues may persist.
* Further investigation and troubleshooting are likely required to address remaining lag concerns.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of timely communication and updates from developers to address user issues.
* It also emphasizes the need for thorough testing and regression avoidance during software development.

recommendations: **Address Pieces OS Performance Issues:** Investigate and address the root causes of high CPU usage, slow performance, and lag in Pieces OS, particularly related to Long Term Memory (LTM).  Prioritize resolving issues linked to specific versions, WebView applications, and hardware configurations.

**Improve Pieces Copilot Responsiveness and Accuracy:** Address the issue of Pieces Copilot providing vague responses instead of actionable solutions. Investigate potential links to specific LLM versions, resource constraints, or data flow issues.

**Enhance Pieces OS LTM Stability and Reliability:** Focus on resolving issues related to LTM activation failures, conflicts with other applications, and performance problems. Improve user guidance and troubleshooting steps for LTM-related issues.

**Resolve Pieces OS Functionality Problems:** Address issues such as Ollama installation failures on Linux and persistent problems with generating and using shareable links. Ensure timely patching and updates for critical functionality.

**Improve Pieces Desktop App Stability and Performance:** Address 'message is empty' errors, slow performance, and launch failures in the Pieces desktop app across Windows and Mac. Prioritize bug fixes, performance improvements, and thorough testing before releasing updates.

**Proactive Communication and Updates:** Provide timely and transparent communication to users regarding known issues, bug fixes, and planned updates.  Keep users informed about the progress of issue resolution and expected timelines.

**Enhanced Troubleshooting Resources:** Expand troubleshooting documentation and resources for common issues, including detailed steps, FAQs, and known workarounds. Make it easy for users to find solutions and self-serve whenever possible.

**Prioritize Issues Based on Impact and Frequency:** Use data on ticket volume, activity levels, and user impact to prioritize issue resolution. Focus on addressing widespread problems and those causing significant disruption first.

**Gather Detailed User Feedback:** Implement mechanisms to collect detailed user feedback on specific issues, including steps to reproduce, system configurations, and expected behavior. This will aid in faster and more effective bug fixing.

**Continuous Testing and Quality Assurance:** Strengthen testing procedures to catch issues early in the development cycle. Implement rigorous regression testing to prevent recurring problems after updates and new feature releases.
